page.title: 13THE HARE AND HOUNDS
page.content:
The Hare and Hounds is situated South_East of Newport. It used to be a coaching house. The thatched part of the Inn dates from the 15th century. It is called the Hare and Hounds because of the hunting there, and has some fascinating relics. A beam, which holds little hooks, was used to hang Michael Morey. He murdered his wife and children, and burnt the house in 1735. There is also a Bronze Aged skull on display. It was discovered inside a nearby mound.
The Inn has two bars open to the public. It has a lounge and a saloon offering a wide range of pub food. Being a holiday island, trade varies, but the Inn employs approximately 22 people at the height of the season.
